conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the image to understand the flow paths of the liquid through the baffles. I will identify the connections between the containers and the baffles, then determine which container the liquid will flow into based on these connections.

Identify the containers from which liquid will flow: A, B, C, and D.
Observe the arrows pointing from these containers to the baffles.
Note the connections between the baffles and the containers E, F, and G.

premise: A has an arrow pointing to a baffle, which connects to E.
conclusion: Stream A ends in container E.

premise: B has an arrow pointing to a baffle, which connects to F.
conclusion: Stream B ends in container F.

premise: C has an arrow pointing to a baffle, which connects to G.
conclusion: Stream C ends in container G.

premise: D has an arrow pointing to a baffle, which connects to E.

premise: Based on these connections, predict which container the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
